docs.snippet: CASTEL GANDOLFO, Italy, Sept. 1 (AP) -- The United States qualified in five straight Olympic rowing events today before the streak was broken by the defeat of the doubles sculls team of Jack Kelly and Bill Knecht.
docs.lead_paragraph: CASTEL GANDOLFO, Italy, Sept. 1 (AP) -- The United States qualified in five straight Olympic rowing events today before the streak was broken by the defeat of the doubles sculls team of Jack Kelly and Bill Knecht.

headline.main: U.S. ROWERS WIN FIVE REPECHAGES; Only Kelly and Knecht Lose -- Parker and 2 Seattle Crews Reach Finals

docs.snippet: ROME, Sept. 1 (UPI) -- America's talented basketball team crushed outmanned Yugoslavia, 104-42, today in one of the most one-sided games in the history of the Olympic tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: ROME, Sept. 1 (UPI) -- America's talented basketball team crushed outmanned Yugoslavia, 104-42, today in one of the most one-sided games in the history of the Olympic tournament.

headline.main: U.S. FIVE CRUSHES YUGOSLAVS, 104-42; Losers Without Field Goal 10 Minutes -- Dischinger and Robertson Star

docs.snippet: ROME, Sept. 1 -- American swimmers partly atoned tonight for the disastrous afternoon suffered by American runners and jumpers.
docs.lead_paragraph: ROME, Sept. 1 -- American swimmers partly atoned tonight for the disastrous afternoon suffered by American runners and jumpers.
docs.abstract: US wins men's 400-m medley and 800-m free-style relays

headline.main: CHRIS VON SALTZA WINS WOMEN'S 400; Americans Clip Relay Marks in 400-Meter Medle and 800-Meter Free-Style

byline.original: By ROBERT DALEYSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: ROME, Sept. 2 (AP) -- The United States Olympic basketball team, warming up for tomorrow night's semi-final showdown with Russia, crushed Uruguay, 108 -- 50, today for its fifth straight victory.
docs.lead_paragraph: ROME, Sept. 2 (AP) -- The United States Olympic basketball team, warming up for tomorrow night's semi-final showdown with Russia, crushed Uruguay, 108 -- 50, today for its fifth straight victory.

headline.main: U.S. FIVE CRUSHES URUGUAY, 108 TO 50; First Team Used Sparingly in Easy Olympic Victory -- Smith Paces Scorers

docs.snippet: HONG KONG, Sept. 3 -- Liu Shao-chi, head of state of Communist China, said tonight the Chinese people were "very happy" to learn Cuba had decided to sever her ties with Nationalist China and establish diplomatic relations with Peiping.
docs.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG, Sept. 3 -- Liu Shao-chi, head of state of Communist China, said tonight the Chinese people were "very happy" to learn Cuba had decided to sever her ties with Nationalist China and establish diplomatic relations with Peiping.
docs.abstract: Communist Chinese head of state Liu Shao-chi, assailing US, sees peace only through anti-imperialist struggle

headline.main: PEIPING PLEDGES SUPPORT TO CUBA; Chinese Will Stand Against U.S. in Latin America, Head of State Says

docs.snippet: The executive vice president of the New York Board of Rabbis has appealed to American Jews to give immediate religious and educational aid to 700,000 South American Jews.
docs.lead_paragraph: The executive vice president of the New York Board of Rabbis has appealed to American Jews to give immediate religious and educational aid to 700,000 South American Jews.
docs.abstract: NY Rabbis Bd exec vp Gordon urges US Jews give immediate religious and educ aid, int on return from tour; notes need for sems in major cities

headline.main: U.S. Rabbi Urges Immediate Aid For the Jews of South America

docs.snippet: AFTER six years of existence as an independent musical organization, the Symphony of the Air began a promising seventh season on Friday with a concert give in Washington under the direction of Aaron Copland.
docs.lead_paragraph: AFTER six years of existence as an independent musical organization, the Symphony of the Air began a promising seventh season on Friday with a concert give in Washington under the direction of Aaron Copland.

headline.main: WORLD OF MUSIC; Symphony of the Air Begins Busy Season

docs.snippet: Week Ended Sept. 2, 1960 Foreign exchange market was very active during the past week. British pound sterling maintained a firm undertone while the movement of the Canadian dollar was erratic.

docs.snippet: MOSCOW, Sept. 6 -- The Soviet Union presented today two young United States defectors from the top-secret National Security Agency in Washington.
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Sept. 6 -- The Soviet Union presented today two young United States defectors from the top-secret National Security Agency in Washington.
